article:
{{Infobox flag |Name = United States of America |Article = the |Image = Flag of
the United States.svg |Nickname = The Stars and Stripes; Red, White and Blue;
Old Glory; The Star-Spangled Banner |Use = 111111 |Symbol = |Proportion = 10:19
|Adoption = June 14, 1777 (original 13-star version) July 4,
1960 (current 50-star version) |Design = Thirteen horizontal
stripes alternating red and white; in the canton, 50 white stars on a blue field
|Type = National }}

The national 'flag of the [[United States|United States of America]]', often
simply referred to as the 'American flag', consists of thirteen equal horizontal
stripes of red (top and bottom) alternating with white, with a blue rectangle in
the canton (referred to specifically as the "union") bearing fifty small, white,
five-pointed stars arranged in nine offset horizontal rows of six stars (top and
bottom) alternating with rows of five stars. The 50 stars on the flag represent
the 50 states of the United States of America and the 13 stripes represent the
thirteen British colonies that declared independence from the Kingdom of Great
Britain and became the first states in the Union. States are represented
collectively; there is no meaning to particular stars nor stripes.
Nicknames for the flag include the "Stars and Stripes", "Old Glory", Coined
by Captain William Driver, a nineteenth century shipmaster. and "The Star-
Spangled Banner."
categories: National symbols of the United States
